channel.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
channel.description:
# Retribution This is a problematic power on a unique class. It makes it impossible to get away with a claim, since even lynching an Innocent Hunter ensures the death of an evil.
There's no good excuse to avoid getting lynched, and makes it harmful to your team to try to ensure your longevity during the day. I'd remove this entirely.
# Frame/Mindwarp There is no counter play to this power. You have no hint that your results were wrong, they just get screwed up. While it is a strong ability, it is rare and will just come out of no where and screw you over. It's just a pure bastard mechanic, since it rarely succeeds.
If you want to make investigatives untrustworthy, the real answer is somehow tilting the odds in favor of the Scorned. It is the perfect way to make people suspicious of investigators, and you can try to read the person instead of having no way to determine if they are correct.
I'd replace these abilities with some other ones.

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp

hi i am not unseen guys but somebody check me so i can be confirmed plz

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp

item.description:
Fool is perfectly fine as-is IMO

Read full topic

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: MaximusPrime
item.description:
While I agree with some things and disagree with others (It’s complete chaos in here), I still feel like you are acting like every player is super competitive and know what they’re doing. You have to consider every players’ PoV and how the changes will affect them. The majority of players are still relatively new/casual after all. I think while some minor changes would be nice, these hugs changes/reworks you’re thinking of is not fun, especially for a new player. Also I like living as a scorned helping the NK win, when otherwise they would’ve lost without me.

Read full topic

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Fool is a crutch for “Fools”. That crutch is needed for noobs but not for experienced players who don’t need these tools period because higher level play should include more sheriff fake claims and more scum reading attempts rather than lynches biased on a check. Scorned is still important even then to make it even more likely than it already should be. Fool is not.

However in low level play things are just different. His existence discourages meany strategy’s (that shouldn’t work anyway but might in noob games with noob scum) such as VFC and random lynching ect. Again not a problem when everyone knows what they are doing but in low level play it’s important.

Read full topic

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
Scorned is indeed much better than Fool, but even in casual play Fool still does nothing but hinder players from attempting to improve, and is therefore bad for the health of the community in the long-term.

Read full topic

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
AKA: Scorned has frame for when there isn’t a scorned involved. Scorned might not need frame to win but an Assassin or MM need it to survive a dead sheriff with good logs.

Read full topic

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
NightX:

And you can just say your target is the MM or NK of they were checked.

This is irrelevant. The purpose of scorned having frame is for when it isn’t the scorned doing the accusing.

Read full topic

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
As Sheriff or Pally the odds are 100 to 1 someone framed your target.

And you can just say your target is the MM or NK of they were checked.

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
A good fool isn’t playing casually (and thus see oranges shpeel about how f and a good scorned has a job besides winning which is what she needs the frame for (aka she provides doubt to sheriff or obs peeks which can lead to the player being pardoned if they have sufficiently good logs)

Read full topic

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
A good Scorned and Fool don’t need Frame to do their jobs. It’s a social class, their words should be the focus.

Read full topic

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
And how would you know there is an illusionist?

If in a psychic game no one answers when you ask who was linked.

Read full topic

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Allies was a problem because you don’t “move on” from being dead. It was too impactful AND unfun to play against. If it was just 1 of those (like fool is in casual play) then it would be no big deal. However it wasn’t hence why it was removed. Order Execution is fine because it is fun to try and counter play it but it is still impactful enough to be powerful.

Back to the OP’s issue. The fool is needed in some games but not others. In a low skill environment scummy behavior is less likely to be caught so he needs frame in order to do his job. Scorned needs frame to do her job too (but unlike fool she is actually fun to counterplay AND to play as. So she works in a competitive setting) because sheriffs can be confirmed and evils need an explanation for a dead sheriff having a sus check on them and scorned is the answer.

As for mindwarp we could change it to a lingering frame and then it would accomplish a similar purpose as a scorned frame except:

A: You would need to already suspect an illusionist to counterplay it (this is a good thing. Illusionist is trying to cause mislynches not paranoia. Scorned is trying to cause paranoia. (I mean in terms of purpose in the game. Not what the player is trying to do with them))

B: The target is not arbitrary as the Illusionist doesn’t just have 2 targets.

Read full topic

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
orangeandblack5:

However, there’s a point where the “fun” factor of playing a role is negated by the anti-fun factor of playing against it

This is WHY fool isn’t good in a competitive setting. FoL is a great example. In ToL when no one is playing competitively when a fool is lynched people laugh it off and move on while the fool had a good time to get to that point.

However when people are playing competitively, what was earlier an unexpected surprise becomes a spanner in the works that you can’t do much about without wasting the princes time or hoping there is a knight/hunter. Plus the length of the day in FoL makes it even worse.

Basically in casual play there are far more no lynches which means that usually during that 1-2 days no one would have died anyway. In competitive play this is not true so that 1-2 days means a lot more which pushes it over the line.

Read full topic

However, there’s a point where the “fun” factor of playing a role is negated by the anti-fun factor of playing against it

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Fool has his place and he is fun. However a competitive game is not that place. If you consider ToL competitive or not is up to you.

Read full topic

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Trollbox is too weak to really matter.

It definitely shouldn’t screw with investigations, just look at the title of the thread.

And of course, you can take out a Fool with a Knight, Prince, or even the King if you suspect them.

My biggest objection is Frame and nullifying the day phase.

But I’ll say once again that Fool isn’t a rival. It is most definitely harmful, but killing the Fool is not killing an enemy. You’d always kill an Assassin over a Fool. Fool is inconvenient, not trying to work against you.

Besides, it’s fun to play as, and it makes the BD more cautious, which isn’t a bad thing. Even it’s use as a crutch for new players ultimately makes the game more fun.

While the implementation may be sub optimal, the concept isn’t bad.

Read full topic

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
So let’s make this thing that actively hinders the BD’s actions, screws with its investigations, and can even make others say things they wouldn’t say, which is obviously and undeniably anti-BD, punish the BD when they use their only true and consistent method of eliminating their rivals to do just that.

If that isn’t backwards I don’t know what is.

Read full topic

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Evil classes need you to lose.

Unseen/Cult is Evil. NK is evil.

Why Fool is harmful, it isn’t actively seeking your loss.

Read full topic

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
Is it BD? No.

Is it BD-sided? Also no.

Does it actively harm the BD? Yes indeed.

Literally the textbook definition of scum.

Read full topic

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
I blame that on players trying to be too obvious or just spamming and hoping they get killed

Think about what you think is scummy, and just do that. It’s not hard.

Read full topic

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
orangeandblack5:

If you are correct, and you have found scum, there should be no scenario in which you are punished for your correct deduction.

Fool isn’t Scum.

Read full topic

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
Okay what

What part of “This is scum, let’s lynch it.” should require any more second-guessing than “What if I’m wrong and we mislynch?”

If you are correct, and you have found scum, there should be no scenario in which you are punished for your correct deduction.

Read full topic

item.title: Why we should replace/remove Retribution/Frame/Mindwarp

item.description:
Bos says the winrate is 30%

I really do feel like Fool doesn’t need buffs like Frame, however.
